text: The voiced alveolar stop is a type of consonant. The letter for this sound in the International Phonetic Alphabet is ⟨⟩. The X-SAMPA symbol for this sound is . The English language has this sound, and it is the sound represented by "d" in dear and desk. == Features == == Examples == Language Word IPA Meaning Adyghe /daahė 'pretty' Assyrian ܘܪܕܐ ] 'flower' Bengali ডাব/ḍab 'green coconut' Catalan 'said before' Czech 'into' Dutch 'roof' English Most speakers dash 'dash' Finnish 'bond' Greek 'shame' Hebrew / do'ar 'mail' Hungarian 'tax' Kabardian / daahė 'pretty' Korean / adeul 'son' Kurdish Northern 'tooth' Central / dadân Southern /dîân Luxembourgish 'brother' Malay Standard (incl. Malaysian) rowspan="3" 'branch' Indonesian Kelantan-Pattani [dahɛː] Maltese 'wit' Thai / dāw 'star' Welsh diafol [djavɔl] 'devil' West Frisian 'village' Yi / 'competent' Yonaguni / dunan 'Yonaguni' == Notes == ==References== * * * Category:Consonants
title: Voiced alveolar plosive
